advantages: Improves the efficiency of linear search by eliminating the need for boundary checks, which can speed up searches in practice.
Simple to implement and understand, making it a good educational tool.
Effective for small datasets where linear search is already sufficient.
disadvantages: Still has a worst-case time complexity of O(n), making it inefficient for large datasets.

Not suitable for linked lists, as the concept of a sentinel is less effective without random access.
